intro: Arachniodes simplicior, commonly known as the simple-leafed spider fern, is a species of evergreen fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lacy fronds that resemble spider webs, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are bi-lobed and have a distinctive, intricate pattern of veins. Arachniodes simplicior is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in indirect light.
